title: Arsenal vs Chelsea WSL : TV channel , live stream , team news & prediction
body_text:
Arsenal vs Chelsea WSL: TV channel, live stream, team news & prediction
By Ali Rampling
There is a mouthwatering clash at the summit of the WSL on Sunday, as second place Arsenal welcome league leaders Chelsea to the Emirates.
Just three points separate the two sides at the top of the table, and the Gunners have a game in hand over their London rivals.
Sunday's result could have a big hand in determining where the WSL title ends up this season, leaving everything pointing towards a fascinating encounter.
Where to watch Arsenal vs Chelsea WSL on TV/live stream
When is kick off? Sunday 15 January, 12:00 (GMT)
Where is the match being played? Emirates Stadium
TV channel/live stream? Sky Sports Main Event/Sky Sports Football (UK) FA Player (international)
What time does coverage start in the UK? 11:30 (GMT)
Referee? Emily Heaslip
Arsenal team news
Beth Mead and Vivianne Miedema are long-term absentees for Arsenal, with the pair both sidelined with ACL ruptures.
Kim Little returned to action from the bench against Zurich in Arsenal's final match of 2022 following over a month on the sidelines with a knee injury.
The Gunners have brought in three new faces this January: Victoria Pelova, Kathrine Kuhl and Sabrina D'Angelo, while Gio Queiroz has been recalled from Everton.
Chelsea team news
Pernille Harder remains sidelined for Chelsea with a hamstring injury sustained in November. Emma Hayes confirmed the squad was otherwise in good shape.
Melanie Leupolz returned to Chelsea training at the beginning of January after giving birth to her first child in October.
Arsenal vs Chelsea score prediction
Both teams have been almost flawless in the league this season, each losing just a solitary game.
Chelsea turned in their best performance of the campaign in their final outing before the winter break with a 3-0 win over PSG. Arsenal contended well with their extensive list of injuries and will be boosted by the return of a fully fit Kim Little plus three January arrivals.
It promises to be an entertaining encounter but there may be nothing to separate the two sides, leaving the title race hanging in the balance.
